meanings.definition: A complete change of form or appearance into a more beautiful or spiritual state.
meanings.sent1: The transfiguration of the caterpillar into a butterfly is a miraculous process.
meanings.sent2: The artist's transfiguration of the landscape brought out its true beauty.
meanings.sent3: Witnessing the transfiguration of a plain pumpkin into a beautifully carved jack-o'-lantern is always a delight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a transfiguration, lighting up the room with its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The transfiguration of the old, abandoned house into a cozy home was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The act of transforming or changing into something more elevated or exalted.
meanings.sent1: The transfiguration of the ordinary into the extraordinary is a theme in many fairy tales.
meanings.sent2: His speech at the ceremony was a transfiguration of his usual reserved self into a confident speaker.
meanings.sent3: The transfiguration of a simple cupcake into an elaborate dessert masterpiece was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise marked the transfiguration of the dark night into a bright new day.
meanings.sent5: The transfiguration of the small town into a bustling city was a sight to behold.
